q: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
h:
“A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.” —
John Lennon

q: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
h:
“Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.” —
Rumi

q: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
h:
“The question is not what you look at, but what you see.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
h:
“Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Catch, then, O catch the transient hour; Improve each moment as it flies!
h:
“Catch, then, O catch the transient hour; Improve each moment as it flies! ” —
St. Jerome

q: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
h:
“It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.” —
Herman Melville

q: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.
h:
“Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.
h:
“Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
h:
“No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Being a good example is the best form of service.
h:
“Being a good example is the best form of service.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
h:
“Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.” —
Aristotle

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.” —
Seneca

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
h:
“To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Art is the signature of civilizations.
h:
“Art is the signature of civilizations. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Love is the absence of judgment.
h:
“Love is the absence of judgment.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Freeing oneself from words is liberation.
h:
“Freeing oneself from words is liberation. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
h:
“Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.
h:
“They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
h:
“Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
h:
“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
h:
“Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don�t respect, appreciate, and value you.
h:
“Life is too short to waste your time on people who don�t respect, appreciate, and value you.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
h:
“All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.
h:
“The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.” —
James Allen

q: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.
h:
“I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Intelligent people make many mistakes because they cannot believe the world is really as foolish as it is.
h:
“Intelligent people make many mistakes because they cannot believe the world is really as foolish as it is.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
h:
“If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.
h:
“A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
h:
“Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
h:
“People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Carl Jung

q: For things to change, you have to change.
h:
“For things to change, you have to change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
h:
“Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it. ” —
Charles Swindoll

q: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
h:
“The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
h:
“The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.
h:
“Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.” —
Robert Greene

q: A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.
h:
“A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: To become what you are not, behave as you do not.
h:
“To become what you are not, behave as you do not.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
h:
“Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are done by a series of small things brought together. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The problem happens when we have multiple desires. When we have fuzzy desires. When we want to do ten different things and we're not clear about which is the one we care about.
h:
“The problem happens when we have multiple desires. When we have fuzzy desires. When we want to do ten different things and we're not clear about which is the one we care about.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.
h:
“As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.” —
James Allen

q: Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.
h:
“Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.” —
Les Brown

q: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
h:
“Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
h:
“Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
h:
“Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.” —
William Faulkner

q: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power.
h:
“One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi
